required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Examine the Effects of Exenatide Once-Weekly Injection on Glucose Control and Safety in Asian Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparator-Controlled Study to Examine the Effects of Exenatide Once-Weekly Injection on Glucose Control (HbA1c) and Safety in Asian Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Managed With Oral Antidiabetic Medications

brief_summary.textblock: Previous studies have suggested that a once-weekly formulation of exenatide may provide sustained glycemic control. These previous studies of exenatide once weekly have been conducted in non-Asian populations, so this study has been developed to support the local regulatory requirements of China, Korea, Japan, India, and Taiwan.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 26.
primary_outcome.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline to Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Achieving HbA1c Targets <=7% at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients achieving HbA1c <=7% at Week 26 (for patients with HbA1c >7% at baseline).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Achieving HbA1c Targets <=6.5% at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients achieving HbA1c <=6.5% at Week 26 (for patients with HbA1c >6.5% at baseline).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Serum Glucose (FSG) From Baseline to Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Change in FSG from baseline to Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Weight (BW) From Baseline to Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Change in BW from baseline to Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Total Cholesterol (TC) From Baseline to Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Change in TC from baseline to Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in High-Density Lipoprotein (HDL) From Baseline to Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Change in HDL from baseline to Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of Triglycerides (TG) at Week 26 to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of TG (measured in mg/dL) at Week 26 to baseline. Log(Post-baseline TG) - log(Baseline TG); change from baseline to Week 26 is presented as ratio of Week 26 to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Blood Pressure From Baseline to Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Change in systolic blood pressure and diastolic blood pressure from baseline to Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events
secondary_outcome.description: Major hypoglycemia: any episode with symptoms consistent with hypoglycemia that resulted in loss of consciousness or seizure with prompt recovery in response to administration of glucagon or glucose OR documented hypoglycemia (blood glucose <3.0 mmol/L [54 mg/dL]) and required the assistance of another person. Minor hypoglycemia: any sign or symptom associated with hypoglycemia that is either self-treated by the patient or resolves on its own AND has a concurrent finger stick blood glucose <3.0 mmol/L (54 mg/dL) and not classified as major hypoglycemia. Event rate per subject year was calculated for each subject: (number of events observed from a subject/exposure from a subject)*365.25 where exposure = last post-baseline visit date - baseline visit date. Mean and Standard Error were then derived from ITT.

intervention.description: 5mcg subcutaneous injection twice a day (4 weeks), 10mcg subcutaneous injection twice a day (22 weeks)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have been diagnosed with type 2 diabetes.
- Have suboptimal glycemic control as evidenced by an HbA1c between 7.1% and 11.0% inclusive.
- Have a body mass index (BMI) of >21 kg/m2 and <35 kg/m2, inclusive.
- Have a history of stable body weight (not varying by >5% for at least 90 days prior to study start).
- Have been treated with a stable dose regimen of Met, SU, TZD, Met plus SU, Met plus TZD, or SU plus TZD for at least 90 days prior to study start.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have any contraindication for the OAD(s) that they use.
- Have a known allergy or hypersensitivity to exenatide BID, exenatide QW, or excipients contained in these agents.
- Have received chronic >14 consecutive days) systemic glucocorticoid therapy by oral, intravenous (IV), or intramuscular (IM) route or intra-articular steroid injection within 4 weeks prior to study start or are regularly treated with potent, inhaled steroids that are known to have a high rate of systemic absorption.
- Have been treated with drugs that promote weight loss (for example, GLP-1 analogue, orlistat, sibutramine, phenylpropanolamine, or similar over-the-counter medications) within 90 days of study start.
- Have been treated for >2 weeks with any of the following excluded medications within 90 days prior to study start:
- Insulin
- Dipeptidyl peptidase (DPP)-4 inhibitors (for example, sitagliptin or vildagliptin)
- Pramlintide acetate
- Drugs that directly affect gastrointestinal motility, including, but not limited to: Reglan® (metoclopramide), Propulsid® (cisapride), and chronic macrolide antibiotics.
- Have had prior exposure to exenatide
- Have previously completed or withdrawn from this study or any other study investigating exenatide BID or QW.
- Have received treatment within the last 30 days with a drug that has not received regulatory approval for any indication at the time of study entry.
- Are currently enrolled in any other clinical study.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 22 weeks)

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Lack of Efficacy-Loss of Glucose Control

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 22 weeks)

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 26.
outcome.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline to Week 26.
outcome.population: ITT Population: Randomized patients received at least one dose of study drug. Only patients with non-missing baseline value and at least one non-missing post-baseline value of the response variable were included in analysis.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 22 weeks)

measure.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 26.
measure.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline to Week 26.
measure.population: ITT Population: Randomized patients received at least one dose of study drug. Only patients with non-missing baseline value and at least one non-missing post-baseline value of the response variable were included in analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: MMRM analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model includes treatment, baseline HbA1c, country, background OAD, week of visit, and treatment-by-week interaction as fixed effects; and patient and error as random effects. Power: 306 patients per treatment group provides approximately 98% power to detect a true difference between treatments of 0.4% in change in HbA1c from baseline with a 2-sided t test at a significance level of 0.05, assuming a common standard deviation of 1.2%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Superiority of exenatide once weekly to exenatide twice daily concluded if upper limit of the 2-sided 95% confidence interval for treatment difference is <0; noninferiority concluded if upper limit is <0.4%.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Achieving HbA1c Targets <=7% at Week 26
outcome.description: Percentage of patients achieving HbA1c <=7% at Week 26 (for patients with HbA1c >7% at baseline).
outcome.population: ITT Population. Only patients with baseline HbA1c > target were included in calculation. Only patients with non-missing baseline value and at least one non-missing post-baseline value of the response variable were included in analysis. Missing data at endpoint was imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF) approach.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 22 weeks)

measure.title: Percentage of Patients Achieving HbA1c Targets <=7% at Week 26
measure.description: Percentage of patients achieving HbA1c <=7% at Week 26 (for patients with HbA1c >7% at baseline).
measure.population: ITT Population. Only patients with baseline HbA1c > target were included in calculation. Only patients with non-missing baseline value and at least one non-missing post-baseline value of the response variable were included in analysis. Missing data at endpoint was imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF) approach.

analysis.groups_desc: Percentage of patients achieving HbA1c target <=7% at Week 26 were compared between treatments using a Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel (CMH) test, in which country and background OAD served as the stratification factors.

outcome.population: ITT Population. Only patients with baseline HbA1c > target were included in calculation. Only patients with non-missing baseline value and at least one non-missing post-baseline value of the response variable were included in analysis. Missing data at endpoint was imputed using LOCF approach.

outcome.title: Ratio of Triglycerides (TG) at Week 26 to Baseline
outcome.description: Ratio of TG (measured in mg/dL) at Week 26 to baseline. Log(Post-baseline TG) - log(Baseline TG); change from baseline to Week 26 is presented as ratio of Week 26 to baseline.
outcome.population: ITT Population. Only patients with non-missing baseline value and at least one non-missing post-baseline value of the response variable were included in analysis.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 22 weeks)

measure.title: Ratio of Triglycerides (TG) at Week 26 to Baseline
measure.description: Ratio of TG (measured in mg/dL) at Week 26 to baseline. Log(Post-baseline TG) - log(Baseline TG); change from baseline to Week 26 is presented as ratio of Week 26 to baseline.
measure.population: ITT Population. Only patients with non-missing baseline value and at least one non-missing post-baseline value of the response variable were included in analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: TG data were logarithm-transformed and the change at Week 26 to baseline, expressed as the ratio, was analyzed using a MMRM ANCOVA model with treatment, baseline TG, country, background OAD, week of visit, and treatment-by-week interaction as fixed effects; and patient and error as random effects.

outcome.title: Change in Blood Pressure From Baseline to Week 26
outcome.description: Change in systolic blood pressure and diastolic blood pressure from baseline to Week 26.
outcome.population: ITT Population. Only patients with non-missing baseline value and at least one non-missing post-baseline value of the response variable were included in analysis. Missing data at endpoint was not imputed.

outcome.title: Assessment of Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events
outcome.description: Major hypoglycemia: any episode with symptoms consistent with hypoglycemia that resulted in loss of consciousness or seizure with prompt recovery in response to administration of glucagon or glucose OR documented hypoglycemia (blood glucose <3.0 mmol/L [54 mg/dL]) and required the assistance of another person. Minor hypoglycemia: any sign or symptom associated with hypoglycemia that is either self-treated by the patient or resolves on its own AND has a concurrent finger stick blood glucose <3.0 mmol/L (54 mg/dL) and not classified as major hypoglycemia. Event rate per subject year was calculated for each subject: (number of events observed from a subject/exposure from a subject)*365.25 where exposure = last post-baseline visit date - baseline visit date. Mean and Standard Error were then derived from ITT.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly With SU Use at Screening
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week and with SU use at Screening

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily With SU Use at Screening
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 22 weeks) and with SU use at Screening

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly Without SU Use at Screening
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week and without SU use at Screening

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily Without SU Use at Screening
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 22 weeks) and without SU use at Screening

measure.title: Assessment of Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events
measure.description: Major hypoglycemia: any episode with symptoms consistent with hypoglycemia that resulted in loss of consciousness or seizure with prompt recovery in response to administration of glucagon or glucose OR documented hypoglycemia (blood glucose <3.0 mmol/L [54 mg/dL]) and required the assistance of another person. Minor hypoglycemia: any sign or symptom associated with hypoglycemia that is either self-treated by the patient or resolves on its own AND has a concurrent finger stick blood glucose <3.0 mmol/L (54 mg/dL) and not classified as major hypoglycemia. Event rate per subject year was calculated for each subject: (number of events observed from a subject/exposure from a subject)*365.25 where exposure = last post-baseline visit date - baseline visit date. Mean and Standard Error were then derived from ITT.

group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 22 weeks)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
